Text:
Rose readies herself to die. To be caught and made
into a pawn would mean her father had died for
nothing.

That is the one thing she absolutely cannot
allow.

But it had been her only option to end the
situation. She had been born a princess and
acted selfishly.

In spite of this, Rose feels that she has fulfilled
the obligations of her position.

So this would be her final duty, and she is prepared
to see it through.
...Until she sees that dazzling flash.
Y-You?!
The time for deception is at an end.
But...is it really you?!
My name is Shadow.
...No, that's not right.
My name is Sha—
Fancy Bandit Slayer!
Fancy―
―Bandit Slayer?!

With such graceful swordplay, I had a feeling it was
you.

From the moment I saw your sword dance, I knew I
wanted to follow the same path.
Rose recalls a memory from her childhood.
She had been abducted once in the past.

Her kidnappers had restrained her in a dingy cabin.
Rough rope bound her hands and feet, and a gag
was in her mouth.

From outside of the cabin she could hear something
very out of place—a child's voice.
Hahah! If you run, you're just bandits!

But if you don't, then you're trained bandits!
Behold, my fancy sword!
C'mon, now, drop that money!

You were really in a bad spot there. Now, take care
on your way home.
Who are you...?
Huh, me? Just someone out for some training...

Guess you could say I'm a fancy bandit slayer who
happened to pass by.
Fancy Bandit Slayer...

It is a precious memory from her youth. A secret
that Rose had never shared with another soul.
Shadow. So you were the Fancy Bandit Slayer.
His silence is all the answer she needed.

You've been fighting evil ever since, never afraid
to go at it alone. Meanwhile, I wanted to die to find
peace.

Even though I could have struggled on, in pain and
in fear.
Hold your head high. Your battle is yet unfinished.
Understood.
W-Wait! Don't let them escape!
You aren't going anywhere.

Fancy... No, Shadow, you wretch. Is there no one
brave among you?

The Midgar knights have Shadow surrounded at a
distance but do not move to seize him.

Not a soul doubts his power after the way he had
defeated Iris.
I'll take care of it.

In an instant, her steel meets Shadow's with a
wave of force.
(Beatrix the War Goddess?!)
(But with this...)

Rain begins to pour down, practically hammering all
present with large drops.

A violent blast of lightning illuminates the two
combatants.
